Name: RxDB
Description: A fast, local-first, reactive Database for JavaScript Applications
UniquenessNote: RxDB focuses on local-first reactivity (observable queries) with pluggable storage engines and multiple replication options (HTTP endpoints, CouchDB, GraphQL, WebSocket, WebRTC P2P).

Platform.comment: Core targets web + Node; mobile via React Native / Capacitor / native bridges depending on storage/replication setup.

Topology.comment: P2P is also possible via WebRTC replication.

ExistingDatabaseSupport.comment: Via replication plugins / custom replication endpoints (backend-dependent)

PersistenceMechanism.comment: Pluggable storage engines; exact options vary by environment and plugins.

SchemaManagement.comment: Uses JSON Schema; migration support via plugins.

DataSize.data: Depends on which storage is used

ConflictHandling.comment: Conflict handling depends on replication strategy; RxDB supports providing custom handlers (and can integrate CRDT-style approaches via plugins).

Authority.comment: Most deployments use a server; can be decentralized in P2P WebRTC setups.

Latency.comment: Network sync latency depends on transport; local reads are instant.

Throughput.data: Varies by replication plugin/backend and document sizes

Concurrency.data: Multi-device + multi-tab capable (replication coordination is supported)

AuthenticationMethod.comment: Authentication/authorization is typically handled by the replication backend (e.g., your API).

AuthorizationPermissions.comment: Usually enforced server-side in your replication endpoints/backends.

Components.comment: RxDB is a database layer, not a UI component library.

DebuggingTools.comment: Includes development-mode checks; inspection/debugging often done via browser storage inspectors and logging.

TypeSupport.data: TypeScript supported; typings depend on your schema and app setup
